TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals living in GPE ( GPE ) . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) .
On DATE the applicants filed an application for a building permit for a weekend cottage .
On DATE the Mayor of ORG - Turrach dismissed the applicants’ application for a building permit . The applicants appealed against this decision .
On DATE the Mayor granted the building permit . On CARDINAL DATE ORG declared the decision null and void as the building permit was contrary to the area zoning plan ( GPE ) .

On DATE the Mayor issued a demolition order . He found that the applicants had to stop the construction works and to demolish these parts of their cottage already built and to recultivate their plot of land within DATE .

On DATE the applicants appealed against this decision and stressed that the construction works had already been terminated in DATE and that the revocation of the building permit granted on DATE had occurred only after the construction of their cottage .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) modified the demolition order and found that the applicants had to demolish their cottage DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants further appeal ( PERSON ) and found that the applicants’ cottage had been constructed contrary to the applicable law , and that the order to declare the building permit null and void had been issued DATE after the building permit was wrongly granted .
On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG .
On DATE the ORG declined to deal with the complaint for lack of prospects of success and transferred the case to ORG .
On DATE ORG ordered the applicants to amend their complaint . On DATE they complied with this order . On DATE the LAW - Turrach Municipality submitted its observations .

On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG complaint and found that no building permit existed for their cottage and that , therefore , the demolition order was lawful . This decision was served on the ORG counsel on DATE .
Section CARDINAL of ORG ) deals with the administrative authorities’ duty to decide . Its relevant part reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) Subject to any contrary provision in the administrative regulations , the authorities must give a decision on applications by parties ... and appeals without unnecessary delay , and at DATE after the application or appeal has been lodged .

( CARDINAL ) If the decision is not served on the party within this time - limit , jurisdiction will be transferred to the competent superior authority upon the party ’s written request ( PERSON ) . ... This request has to be refused by the competent superior authority if the delay was not caused by preponderant fault of the authority .
( CARDINAL ) The period for giving a decision by the superior authority runs from the date the request for transfer of jurisdiction was lodged with it . ”
